objects.description:
Prerequisite: some images in gallery, 2 phones with NFC & Bluetooth.

As a user, I would like to have the ability to transfer file by tapping on the other phone.
objects.name: [NFC] Image sharing by tapping phones together (FxOS <-> FxOS)

steps.expected: NFC switched ON on both phones.
steps.instruction: Go to "Settings", Switch on NFC on both phones.

steps.expected: Bluetooth switched ON on both phones.
steps.instruction: Go to "Settings", Switch on Bluetooth on both phones.
Go to "Gallery",  select an image

steps.expected: The phone should be on the preparation screen to submit image.
steps.instruction: Tap two phones together

steps.expected: It should submit successfully.
steps.instruction: Slide forward to send the image

objects.description:
Prerequisite: some image/videos/music in phone, 2 phones with NFC & Bluetooth, 1 Bluetooth speaker/headset.

As a user, I would like to have the ability to transfer file by tapping on the other phone when the phone is also currently playing music through a Bluetooth speaker/headset.
objects.name: [NFC] Image/video/audio file sharing by tapping phones together, currently playing music through a BT speaker/headset

steps.expected: NFC switched ON on both phones.
steps.instruction: Go to "Settings", Switch on NFC on both phones.

steps.expected: Bluetooth switched ON on both phones.
steps.instruction: Go to "Settings", Switch on Bluetooth on both phones.

steps.expected: Phone connected to a Bluetooth speaker/headset.
steps.instruction: Pair/connect a phone with a Bluetooth speaker/headset.

steps.expected: Music played through Bluetooth speaker/headset.
steps.instruction: Go to "Music", play music through a Bluetooth speaker/headset on a phone.

steps.expected: the phone should be on the preparation screen to submit picture (the image/video should tilt a little bit)
steps.instruction: Go to "Galley", tap two phone together

steps.expected: It should submit successfully with no disconnection on bt speaker/headset music
steps.instruction: Slide forward to send the image/video

objects.description:
Prerequisite: some image/videos/music in phone, 2 phones with NFC & Bluetooth.

As a user, I would like to have the ability to transfer file by tapping on the other phone when the Bluetooth is currently turned OFF on both sender and receive phone.
objects.name: [NFC] Image/video/audio file sharing by tapping phones together, currently Bluetooth turned OFF on both sender and receive phone

steps.expected: NFC switched ON on both phones.
steps.instruction: Go to "Settings", Switch on NFC on both phones.

steps.expected: Bluetooth switched OFF on both phones.
steps.instruction: Go to "Settings", Switch off Bluetooth on both phones.

steps.expected: the phone should be on the preparation screen to submit picture (the image/video should tilt a little bit)
steps.instruction: Go to "Galley", tap two phones together

steps.expected: It should submit successfully
steps.instruction: Slide forward to send the image/video

steps.expected: Bluetooth should be OFF status on both phones.
steps.instruction: Check both phones Bluetooth setting

objects.description:
Prerequisite: some image/videos/music in phone, 3 phones (device A, device B, and device C)with NFC & Bluetooth.

As a user, I would like to have the ability to receive file by tapping on the other phone when the phone is currently receiving file from a third phone.
objects.name: [NFC] Image/video/audio file receiving by tapping phones together, currently receiving file from another phone

steps.expected: NFC switched ON on all phones.
steps.instruction: Go to "Settings", Switch on NFC on all phones.

steps.expected: Bluetooth switched ON on all phones.
steps.instruction: Go to "Settings", Switch on Bluetooth on all phones.

steps.expected: Device B would show "Cannot send file right now. Please try again later."
steps.instruction: Tap two phone(device B, device C) together and device B slide forward to send the image/video to device C while device A is transferring file to device C

steps.expected: Device C would show "Cannot send file right now. Please try again later."
steps.instruction: Tap two phone(device B, device C) together and device C slide forward to send the image/video to device B while device A is transferring file to device C

objects.description:
Prerequisite: 2 phones with NFC .

As a user, I would like to have the ability to receive URL by tapping on the other phone, and opened in "Browser"
objects.name: [NFC] URL received by tapping phones together, and opened in Browser (FxOS <-> FxOS)

steps.expected: NFC switched ON on both phones.

objects.description:
As a user, I need a setting menu for dual SIM management.

Prerequisite:
1. Device which supports Dual SIM Dual Standby.
2. Insert 2 SIMs into the device.
objects.name: [DSDS] Access SIM manager from Settings

steps.expected: SIM manager can be found.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings.

steps.expected:
1. Status of SIM including operator name and numbers(optional if SIM card has the information).
2. SIM settings includes SIM security, outgoing call, message and data with default value to SIM 1 when none has been changed before.
3. Setting can be selected to SIM 1 or SIM 2.
steps.instruction: Click SIM manager.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
When there is no SIM card inserted, user can know the status from SIM cards manager.

Prerequisite:
1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby.
2. No SIM card inserted.
objects.name: [DSDS] Access SIM manager when no SIM inserted

steps.expected: Unable to access SIM Manager due to no SIM in device.
steps.instruction: When there is no SIM card inserted into device, go to SIM manager under Settings.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
SIM manager is only for DSDS support device.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which does NOT support Dual SIM Dual Standby.
objects.name: [DSDS] Verify SIM manager on DSDS non-support device

steps.expected: No SIM manger can be found.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
As a user, I can choose either one of available SIMs to for outgoing calls.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIMs into the device.
objects.name: [DSDS] Set primary SIM for outgoing call

steps.expected: SIM manager can be opened.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > SIM manager.
Change outgoing call to different one than current selected by Outgoing Call selection menu.

steps.expected: Call is made by the SIM set in previous step.
steps.instruction: Make a call to other phone.

steps.expected: Call is made from the SIM followed the setting.
steps.instruction: Repeat above steps to change outgoing call via another SIM.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
As a user, I can choose either one of available SIMs to for outgoing messages.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIMs into the device.
objects.name: [DSDS] Set primary SIM for outgoing messages.

steps.expected: SIM cards manager can be opened.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > SIM cards manager.
Change outgoing message to different one than current selected by Outgoing message selection menu.

steps.expected: Check received message and make sure it's from the SIM set in previous step.
steps.instruction: Send a SMS to other phone.

steps.expected: Check received message and make sure it's from the SIM followed by the setting.
steps.instruction: Repeat above steps to change outgoing message via another SIM.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
As a user, I can choose either one of available SIMs to for outgoing data services such as data call, MMS and AGPS.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIMs into the device. 3.
objects.name: [DSDS] Set primary SIM for outgoing internet connection

steps.expected: SIM cards manager can be opened.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > SIM cards manager.
Set SIM 1 as primary outgoing data card.

steps.expected: SIM 1 RSSI on top of the screen has data call icon.
steps.instruction: Enable SIM 1 data call in its Cellular & Data setting.

steps.expected: Content can be loaded via data call.
steps.instruction: Open apps that require internet connection.

steps.expected: A confirmation message pop up.
steps.instruction: Repeat above steps to change outgoing data to SIM2.

steps.expected: RSSI is correct and data call works fine.
steps.instruction: Confirm to change outgoing data.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

Launching a media player to play a RTSP streaming

steps.expected:
The RTSP streaming can be played while the hotspot is turned on.
A loading icon pops up while the hotspot is turned off.
steps.instruction: On/off the hotspot

objects.description:
When primary SIM for outgoing call, message and data is removed, all settings will be changed to existing SIM.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIMs into the device.
objects.name: [DSDS] Remove primary SIM card

steps.expected: SIM manager can be opened.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > SIM manager or open it from utility tray.

steps.expected: Verify dialing out call, sending SMS and data call(3g icon on status bar) are from SIM 2.
steps.instruction: Set SIM 2 as primary SIM for outgoing call, message and data.
Remove SIM 2 and power on device if it does not support hot swap.

steps.expected:
1. SIM 2 is in No SIM card status.
2. Outgoing call, data and message are set to SIM 1 automatically.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > SIM cards manager or open it from utility tray.

steps.expected: All actions are achieved by SIM 1.
steps.instruction: Dialing out call, sending SMS and checking data call(3g icon on status bar)

steps.expected: Outgoing call, data and message are still set to SIM 1
steps.instruction: Insert SIM 2 back and go to SIM manager.

steps.expected: Primary SIM setting will be set to SIM 2.
steps.instruction: Remove SIM 2 and move SIM 1 card to SIM 2 slot.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
Primary SIM settings will not be changed even SIM cards are changed. 

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIMs into the device.
objects.name: [DSDS] Verify primary SIM settings by switching SIM cards

steps.expected: SIM manager can be opened.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > SIM manager.

steps.expected: Verify dialing out call, sending SMS and data call(3g icon on status bar) are from correct SIM.
steps.instruction: Set SIM 1 as primary SIM for outgoing message, SIM 2 for outgoing call and data.
Switch SIM cards and power on device if it does not support hot swap.

steps.expected: SIM settings are still followed SIM 1 as primary SIM for outgoing message, SIM 2 for outgoing call and data.
steps.instruction: Open SIM manager again.

steps.expected: All follow the settings.
steps.instruction: Make originated call, SMS and check data call icon.
Power off device and switch one of the SIM card with another different SIM, then power on device.

steps.expected: Follow the settings.
steps.instruction: Make originated call, SMS and check data call icon.

steps.expected: SIM settings are still followed SIM 1 as primary SIM for outgoing message, SIM 2 for outgoing call and data.
steps.instruction: Open SIM manager again.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
As a user, I would like the be able to queue up multiple BT transfers without
having to wait for the current transfer to end in order to streamline operations.
objects.name: [Bluetooth][Multiple Transfer] failed to transfer part of files

steps.expected: 10 pictures are taken
steps.instruction: Launch "Camera" App and take 10 pictures

steps.expected: there are at least 10 pictures in the gallery
steps.instruction: Launch Gallery

steps.expected: 10 pictures are selected
steps.instruction: Click the "multiple select" icon, and select ten pictures

steps.expected: A list of devices shows up
steps.instruction: Click the "share" icon, and select "Bluetooth Transfer"

steps.expected: In the notification bar, it will show the bt is trying to send the file. Later, it will show "file transfer failed" for 6th~10th file(5 different notifications). Also, a report "Transfer report: 5 files successful, 5 files unsuccessful"
steps.instruction: Click the device you want to send to, and turn of the phone when 5th picture completed its transfer

objects.description:
As a user, I would like the be able to queue up multiple BT transfers without
having to wait for the current transfer to end in order to streamline operations.
objects.name: [Bluetooth][Multiple Transfer] cancel multiple file transferring in the middle of transferring

steps.expected: 10 pictures are taken
steps.instruction: Launch "Camera" App and take 10 pictures

steps.expected: there are at least 10 pictures in the gallery
steps.instruction: Launch Gallery

steps.expected: 10 pictures are selected
steps.instruction: Click the "multiple select" icon, and select ten pictures

steps.expected: A list of devices shows up
steps.instruction: Click the "share" icon, and select "Bluetooth Transfer"

steps.expected: It will show a prompt of "cancel bluetooth file transfer"
steps.instruction: Click the device you want to send to, and cancel the transferring of files on the 5th file

steps.expected: the file transferring canceled
steps.instruction: click "cancel" button

objects.description:
As a user I expect the default option for WLAN to be 802.1x EAP-SIM authentication if this detected as supported by the hotspot

Prerequisite: 
1. Device supports EAP-SIM authentication 
2. SIM card has EAP-SIM authentication service.
3. WiFi Hotspot should support EAP-SIM authentication.
objects.name: [EAP-SIM] First time join WLAN with EAP-SIM

steps.expected: Device's WiFi will connect to WLAN hotspot via EAP-SIM automatically.
steps.instruction: Press SSID name secured by WPA-EAP

steps.expected:
1. Will enter the selected SSID configuration page. 
2. Security type should be "WPA-EAP" and EAP method should be "SIM"
steps.instruction: Go to Settings->WiFi and click the connected SSID item

steps.expected: Browser could open web page successfully and device could surf internet properly after connecting to WLAN with EAP-SIM authentication.
steps.instruction: Launch browser and go to "www.cnn.com"

objects.description:
User Story: User Story:

As a user, I want to access the controls to the music app in a notification tray or enter the music app by swiping on the play icon on the status bar while the homescreen is still unlocked

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=902981
objects.name: [Music] Controls: Verify control functionality when app is accessed from the utility tray

steps.expected: A set of controls show at the bottom of the screen.
steps.instruction: Open the Music app and select a track to play from the Songs tab at the bottom of the music app.

steps.expected: The track should start playing and you should see a pause button render in the UI.
steps.instruction: Press the Play button to begin playing the track.

steps.expected: The Play icon should be visible in the status bar.
steps.instruction: Press the Home button to return to the Home screen.

steps.expected: The notifications tray should open and show details of the current song at the top of the screen. The utility tray should display the song playing, the album art and the music icon. The controls should be visible: play/pause button and back and forward controls.
steps.instruction: Swipe down from the top of the screen to open up the notifications tray.

steps.expected: The track should pause.
steps.instruction: Press the pause button to pause the track.

steps.expected: The track should begin playing.
steps.instruction: Press the play button to restart the track.

steps.expected: You should advance to the next track.
steps.instruction: Press the next track button.

steps.expected: You should return to the previous track.
steps.instruction: Press the previous track button.

objects.description:
Prerequisite: 
1. Device supports EAP-SIM authentication 
2. SIM card has EAP-SIM authentication service.
3. WiFi Hotspot should support EAP-SIM authentication.
4. Disable 3G or other connections except WiFi.
objects.name: [EAP-SIM] Re-Connect to WLAN after authenication is cleaned.

steps.expected: Device could connect to WLAN hotspot properly without problem.
steps.instruction: Device connects to WLAN with EAP-SIM authentication

steps.expected: Web page could be opened and device could surf in the internet properly.
steps.instruction: Try to browse "www.mlb.com" via browser

steps.expected: Original EAP-SIM WiFi network connection should be disconnected.
steps.instruction: Press "forget" button in connected WiFi information page.

steps.expected: It should fail to browse web page.
steps.instruction: Try to browse "www.nba.com" via browser

steps.expected: Device could connect to the WLAN properly without any configuration.
steps.instruction: Tap an EAP-SIM WiFi network to connect to it

steps.expected: Web page could be opened and device could surf in the internet properly.
steps.instruction: Try to browse "www.bbc.com" via browser

objects.description:
As a user, I can program browser APN via over the air client provisioning.

Prerequisite: Using NowSMS(http://www.nowsms.com/) to send WAP Push messages to device.
objects.name: [OTA CP] Program browser APN settings (User PIN)

steps.instruction: Enable WAP Push in Settings > Message setting on DUT.

steps.expected: CP message is received with a configuration message notification.
steps.instruction:
Open NowSMS on PC, go to "OMA provisioning content". Fill in following items (please refer to the carrier's settings of your SIM card, following example is for CHT in Taiwan.) then send to DUT.
1.) Connection Type: GPRS
2.) Settings Name: CHT_emome
3.) GPRS Access Point Name: emome
4.) WAP Proxy IP Address : 10.1.1.1
5.) WAP Proxy Port: 8080
6.) Howe Page URL: http://wap.emome.net/
7.) OTA PIN:1234
8.) OTA PIN Type: Check User PIN

steps.expected: A page required PIN code is opened.
steps.instruction: Open the message.

steps.expected: Confirmation message with setting name "CHT_emome" shows(depending on the Settings Name you enter in step 2.)
steps.instruction: Enter the PIN code and press Accept button.

steps.expected: Successful message will be shown.
steps.instruction: Press "Store".

steps.expected: New profile (CHT_emome in this case) is created.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Cellular & Data > Data settings on DUT.

steps.expected: Data call connection will be re-established without any problem.
steps.instruction: Select it and press ok.

objects.description:
Device should not connect to WLAN with EAP-SIM security authentication in case original SIM card with EAP-SIM service is changed to another one which does not have EAP-SIM service.

Prerequisite:

1. Device have set up the connection with WiFi AP with EAP-SIM security authentication.
2. Prepare two same operator cards. One has EAP-SIM security authentication, another does not have it.
objects.name: [EAP-SIM] SIM cards changed - EAP-SIM card <-> Non EAP-SIM card (same operator)

steps.expected: Device could be turned on and enter system properly
steps.instruction: Insert one SIM card with EAP-SIM security authentication and turn on device

steps.expected: Device should connect to correct EAP-SIM WiFi network belongs to same operator of inserted SIM card.
steps.instruction: Let device be in coverage of EAP-SIM WiFi network, and check WiFi connection status

steps.expected: Browser could be opened and device could surf in the internet properly.
steps.instruction: Try to browse "www.whitehouse.gov" via browser

steps.expected: Device could be turned on and enter system properly
steps.instruction: Insert another SIM card WITHOUT EAP-SIM security authentication and turn on device

steps.expected: 1. Device should NOT connect to WLAN with EAP-SIM security authentication due to inserted SIM does not have the service.
steps.instruction: Check WiFi connection status.

steps.expected: Device could be turned on and enter system properly
steps.instruction: Insert one SIM card with EAP-SIM security authentication and turn on device

steps.expected: Device should connect to correct EAP-SIM WiFi network belongs to same operator of inserted SIM card.
steps.instruction: Check WiFi connection status.

steps.expected: Browser could be opened and device could surf in the internet properly.
steps.instruction: Try to browse "www.cnn.com" via browser

steps.instruction: Call the device from another phone.

Select SIM 1, go to Forward when unanswered under Call forwarding section and enter a valid phone number, then enable it.
Select SIM 2, go to Forward when unanswered under Call forwarding section and enter a valid phone number, then enable it.

steps.expected: Call will be forwarded to the number set for SIM 2, not SIM 1.
steps.instruction: End the call and make a call to SIM 2 from another device and do not answer it.

steps.expected: Call will be forwarded to the number set for SIM 1, not SIM 2.
steps.instruction: Make a call to SIM 1 from another device and do not answer it.

objects.description:
As a user, I can tell which SIM has data call established from status bar.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIMs into the device.
objects.name: [DSDS] Verify RSSI with data call enabled

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > SIM manager
Set outgoing data to SIM 1.

steps.expected: 1. Signal strength for both SIM cards in on status bar. 2. Data call icon(ex: 2G or 3G) is next to SIM 1.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Cellular & Data to enable SIM 1 data call.
Go to SIM manager and change outgoing data to SIM 2.

steps.expected: 1. Signal strength for both SIM cards in on status bar. 2. Data call icon(ex: 2G or 3G) is next to SIM 2.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Cellular & Data to enable SIM 2 data call.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
As a user, I can tell there is no data call established from status bar.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIMs into the device.
objects.name: [DSDS] Verify RSSI with no data call connection

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > SIM manager
Set outgoing data to SIM 1.

steps.expected: 1. Signal strength for both SIM cards in on status bar. 2. No data call icon(ex: 2G or 3G) is next to SIM 1.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Cellular & Data to disable SIM 1 data call.
Go to SIM manager and change outgoing data to SIM 2.

steps.expected: 1. Signal strength for both SIM cards in on status bar. 2. No data call icon(ex: 2G or 3G) is next to SIM 2.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Cellular & Data to disable SIM 2 data call.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
As a user, I can tell which SIM is not inserted from status bar.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. No SIM is inserted.
objects.name: [DSDS] Verify RSSI with only one SIM inserted

steps.instruction: Insert one SIM into SIM 2 slot.

steps.expected: There is a SIM card unavailable icon for SIM 1, and SIM 2 has RSSI next to it.
steps.instruction: Power on device and verify the status bar.
Switch SIM card from SIM 2 slot to SIM 1 slot.

steps.expected: There is a SIM card unavailable icon for SIM 2, and SIM 1 has RSSI next to it.
steps.instruction: Power on device and verify the status bar.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
As a user, I can tell there is no SIM inserted from status bar.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. No SIM is inserted.
objects.name: [DSDS] Verify RSSI with no SIM inserted

steps.expected: SIM card unavailable icons are both next to SIM 1 and SIM 2 indicators.
steps.instruction: Power on device and check status bar.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.

objects.description:
As a user, I can tell which SIM is roaming from status bar.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby.
objects.name: [DSDS] Verify RSSI with roaming SIM

steps.instruction: Insert one roaming and one local SIM card into DUT.

steps.expected: Roaming icon is on the SIM indicator which is the same slot the roaming SIM is in.
steps.instruction: Power on device and check status bar.
Switch both SIM cards.

steps.expected: Roaming icon is on the SIM indicator which is the same slot the roaming SIM is in.
steps.instruction: Power on device and check status bar.

steps.expected: Roaming icons for both SIM are shown on status bar.
steps.instruction: Insert 2 roaming SIM cards into DUT.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
As a user, I can tell which SIM is in PIN locked from status bar.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIM cards into device.
objects.name: [DSDS] Verify RSSI with SIM PIN locked

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > SIM manager > SIM security.
Enable PIN lock on both SIM cards.

steps.expected: 1. SIM 1 PIN entry page will show first. 2. No RSSI on status bar for  both SIM cards.
steps.instruction: Reboot device.

steps.expected: 1. SIM 2 PIN entry page will show. 2. No RSSI on status bar for  both SIM cards.
steps.instruction: Skip PIN unlock page.

steps.expected: SIM 2 RSSI will be displayed on status bar.
steps.instruction: Enter correct SIM 2 PIN to unlock it.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIM cards from different carriers into device.
objects.name: [DSDS] Verify RSSI when out of network coverage

steps.expected: RSSI for both indicates there is no signal right now.
steps.instruction: Go to area where has no signal.

objects.description:
When auto retrieve of secondary data SIM is enabled, MMS attachment can still be retrieved manually.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIMs into the device.
objects.name: [DSDS] Send MMS to secondary SIM card (Auto retrieve on with roaming)

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > SIM manager, set SIM 1 as primary outgoing data.
Go to Settings > Message settings, turn off Auto retrieve.

steps.expected: MMS will be received but attachment is not downloaded.
steps.instruction: Send MMS to SIM 2.

steps.expected: A download button is displayed.
steps.instruction: Open the received MMS.

steps.expected: A warning message indicating that switching data call is required shows.
steps.instruction: Press the download button.

steps.expected: MMS attachment will be downloaded.
steps.instruction: Confirm data call switching.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
When auto retrieve of primary data SIM is disabled, MMS attachment can be retrieved manually.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIMs into the device.

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > SIM manager, set SIM 1 as primary outgoing data.
Go to Settings > Message settings, disable Auto retrieve on SIM 1.

steps.expected: MMS will be received without attachment downloaded.
steps.instruction: Send MMS to SIM 1.

steps.expected: A download button is in the message.
steps.instruction: Open received message.

steps.expected: MMS attachment can be downloaded.

objects.description: Users will be able to attach media/contacts to a MMS and be able to send the message to contacts.
objects.name: [MMS] Send an MMS with picture attached with SIM

steps.expected: Message app opens and displays correctly, all previous threads will be display if they have not been removed.
steps.instruction: Open Message app

steps.expected: New Message screen will appear and display correctly.
steps.instruction: Tap on the Compose icon

steps.expected: Recipient will be added to the text box.
steps.instruction: Enter a recipient in the "To:" text field

steps.expected:
Context menu will display with options:
- Video 
- Music
- Gallery
- Camera
steps.instruction: Tap on Paper Clip icon

steps.expected: Pictures will be populated from the phone.
steps.instruction: Select Gallery

steps.expected: Crop screen will display the photo selected and the user will be able to adjust the photo.
steps.instruction: Select a picture

steps.expected: A preview of the picture selected will be displayed in the text field on the bottom. MMS text will display above the "Send" button.
steps.instruction: Save the cropped image by tapping on the icon in the top right

steps.expected: Image shown.
steps.instruction: Tap on the image, and select 'View'

steps.expected: MMS will be sent to recipient.
steps.instruction: Tap on Send.

steps.expected: Image shown.
steps.instruction: Tap on the image just sent.

objects.description: Users will be able to receive an MMS in the message app.
objects.name: [MMS] Receive an MMS

steps.expected: User will receive a notification displaying a message was received.
steps.instruction: Send an MMS to test device

steps.expected: Message app will open and display a new thread.
steps.instruction: Open Message app

steps.expected: The thread will open and display the messages and attachments located in the thread.
steps.instruction: Tap on received MMS thread

steps.expected: User is prompted with a message asking the user if they would like to download attachments.
steps.instruction: Tap on attachment

objects.description: Users will receive a Notification when an Email has been received.
objects.name: [EMAIL] Notification for Email will display

steps.expected: If no account has been set up on the device the first time Email set up will be displayed.
steps.instruction: Open Email app

steps.expected: After successful login the user is taken to the "New Account" page to configure the account.
steps.instruction: Enter credentials to set up an email account.

steps.expected: The following options are available in the drop-down menu: Manually, Every 5 minutes, Every 10 minutes, Every 15 minutes, Every 30 minutes and Every hour.
steps.instruction: Tap on the "Check for new messages" drop-down and set it to a specific time not "manually".

steps.expected: The toggle should have some sort of visual indication that it is turned on.
steps.instruction: On the new account page, ensure "Display notifications for new messages" is toggled on.

steps.expected: The user is taken to the email account's inbox.
steps.instruction: Tap "Next" and then tap the "Continue to Mail" button on the "Mail account setup" page.

steps.expected: The user is returned to the home screen.
steps.instruction: Tap the Home button.

steps.expected: A notification will be display on the top of the phone when the phone auto checks for new messages.
steps.instruction: Using another device, send email to the test device.

steps.expected: The user is taken directly to that email message.
steps.instruction: Tap on the notification.

objects.description:
As a user, I can import contacts from each SIM.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIMs with contacts into the device.
objects.name: [DSDS] Import contacts from each SIM

steps.expected: There are SIM 1 and SIM 2 available for user to choose.
steps.instruction: Go to Contacts > Settings, tap import contacts.

steps.expected: Contacts on SIM 1 will be imported into devices successfully.
steps.instruction: Select SIM 1.
Go to import contacts in Contacts app again.

steps.expected: Contacts on SIM 2 will be imported into devices successfully.
steps.instruction: Select SIM 2.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
As a user, I can import contacts from SIM card.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby..
objects.name: [DSDS] Import contacts when there is only one SIM

steps.instruction: Insert only one SIM in SIM slot 1.

steps.expected: There are SIM 1 and SIM 2 listed but only SIM 2 is grey out.
steps.instruction: Go to Contacts > Settings, tap import contacts.

steps.expected: Contacts on SIM 1 will be imported into devices successfully.
steps.instruction: Select SIM 1.
Remove SIM 1 and insert another SIM with contacts into SIM slot 2.

steps.expected: There are SIM 1 and SIM 2 listed but only SIM 1 is grey out.
steps.instruction: Go to import contacts in Contacts app again.

steps.expected: Contacts on SIM 2 will be imported into devices successfully.
steps.instruction: Select SIM 2.

tags.name: DSDS

steps.expected: A notification indicating there is no contact detected on the SIM will pop up.

objects.description:
After unlock SIM PIN, user can still import contact from the SIM.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIM cards with contacts into device.
objects.name: [DSDS] Import contacts when SIM PIN is enabled

steps.instruction: Enable SIM 1 and SIM 2 PIN lock.

steps.expected: Once see PIN entry page, skip unlock PIN for both SIM cards.
steps.instruction: Reboot device.

steps.expected: SIM 1 PIN entry page shows.
steps.instruction: Go to Contacts > Settings, tap import contacts.

steps.expected: SIM 2 PIN entry page shows.
steps.instruction: Unlock SIM 1 PIN.

steps.expected: Both SIM 1 and SIM 2 are available in import contacts page.
steps.instruction: Unlock SIM 2 PIN.

steps.expected: Contacts of SIM 1 will be imported successfully.
steps.instruction: Select SIM 1.

steps.expected: Contacts of SIM 2 will be imported successfully.
steps.instruction: Select SIM 2.

tags.name: DSDS

steps.expected: PIN entry page for SIM 2 pops up.

steps.expected: In import contact page, both SIM 1 and SIM 2 are grey out.
steps.instruction: Skip unlock SIM PIN.

objects.description:
As a user, I can enable airplane mode on all SIM cards.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIMs into the device.
objects.name: [DSDS] Enable airplane mode

steps.instruction: Enable Wifi, BT and GPS.

steps.expected: 1. All network related functions are disabled, such as WIFI, BT and GPS. 2. Unable to access Call settings and Cellular & Data. 3. Flight mode icon is shown on RSSI.
steps.instruction: Enable airplane mode from Settings.

steps.expected: Both will not be received.
steps.instruction: Send SMS to both SIM 1 and SIM 2.

steps.expected: Both will not be received.
steps.instruction: Make calls to SIM 1 and SIM 2.

steps.expected: Data call is not working.
steps.instruction: Browse web pages.

objects.description:
As a user, I can disable airplane mode on all SIM cards.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIMs into the device.
objects.name: [DSDS] Disable airplane mode

steps.instruction: Enable WiFi, BT and GPS.
Enable airplane mode from Settings.

steps.expected: 1. All network related functions are enabled, such as WIFI, BT and GPS. 2. SIM manager, Call Settings and Cellular & Data can be accessed. 2. Both SIM 1 and SIM 2 RSSI can be seen on status bar.
steps.instruction: After flight mode icon is on status bar, disable airplane mode.

steps.expected: Both will be received.
steps.instruction: Send SMS to both SIM 1 and SIM 2.

steps.expected: Both will  be received.
steps.instruction: Make calls to SIM 1 and SIM 2.

steps.expected: Data call is working.
steps.instruction: Browser web pages.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
As a user, I can get PIN request page after disabling airplane mode on all SIM cards.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby. 2. Insert 2 SIMs into the device.
objects.name: [DSDS] Disable airplane mode (PIN enabled)

steps.instruction: Enable SIM 1 PIN lock in Settings > SIM manager > SIM security.
Enable WiFi, BT and GPS.
Enable airplane mode.

steps.expected:
1. Wifi, BT and GPS will be turned on.
2. SIM PIN may or may not be locked. It depends on how modem design it. For example, if device uses Spreadtrum modem, it won't lock SIM. But for Qualcomm solution, user need to unlock SIM 1 PIN first to camp on network.
steps.instruction: After flight mode icon is on status bar, disable airplane mode.
Enable SIM 2 PIN lock in Settings > SIM manager > SIM security.
Enable airplane mode.

steps.expected:
1. Wifi, BT and GPS will be turned on.
2. SIM PIN may or may not be locked. It depends on how modem design it. For example, if device uses Spreadtrum modem, it won't lock SIM. But for Qualcomm solution, user need to unlock both SIM 1 and SIM 2 PIN code first to camp on network.
steps.instruction: After flight mode icon is on status bar, disable airplane mode.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.

objects.description:

steps.expected: Call can be answered from BT headset.

steps.expected: Call can also be answered from BT headset.
steps.instruction: End the call and dial a call to SIM 2.

objects.description:
As a user, I can answer second incoming call with Bluetooth headset.

Prerequisite:
1. Device which supports Dual SIM Dual Standby.
2. Insert 2 SIMs into the device.
3. Pair a Bluetooth headset with device.
4. Call waiting is enabled for both SIM.
objects.name: [DSDS][BT] Answer second incoming call with Bluetooth headset

steps.expected: Call can be answered.
steps.instruction: Dial a call to SIM 1 and answer the call with BT headset.

steps.expected: Incoming call notification shows.
steps.instruction: Dial another call to SIM 1.

steps.expected: First call is put on hold and second call is answered and both lines can heard from each other.
steps.instruction: Answer second call via BT headset or from dialer if BT headset cannot answer it.

steps.expected: First call is put on hold and second call is answered and both lines can heard from each other.
steps.instruction: Repeat step 1 to 3 by dial call to SIM 2

objects.description:
As a user, I can end present call with BT headset and reconnect to on hold one.

Prerequisite:
1. Device which supports Dual SIM Dual Standby.
2. Insert 2 SIMs into the device.
3. Pair a Bluetooth headset with device.
4. Call waiting is enabled for both SIM.
objects.name: [DSDS][BT] End one of two calls with Bluetooth headset

steps.expected: Call can be answered.
steps.instruction: Dial a call to one of the SIM cards and answer the call with BT headset.

steps.expected: Incoming call notification shows.
steps.instruction: Dial another call to the same SIM card again.

steps.expected: First call is put on hold and second call is answered and both lines can heard from each other.
steps.instruction: Answer second call via BT headset or from dialer if BT headset cannot answer it.

steps.expected: Current call is terminated and second call put on hold will resume. Both lines can heard from each other.
steps.instruction: Press BT call button to end current active call.

objects.description:
As a user, I can use USB tethering no matter which SIM is set for primary outgoing data.

Prerequisite:
1. Device which supports Dual SIM Dual Standby.
2. Insert 2 SIMs into the device.
objects.name: [DSDS] Turn on USB tethering

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Cellular & Data, enable data call of primary outgoing data SIM.

steps.expected: PC can connect to internet via this connection.(e.g. verify by opening web pages)
steps.instruction: Enable USB tethering from Internet sharing setting and connect to PC with USB.
Unplug USB.
Go to Settings > SIM manager, change primary outgoing data to another SIM other than current one.
Go to Settings > Cellular & Data, enable data call of primary outgoing data SIM.

steps.expected: PC can connect to internet via this connection.(e.g. verify by opening web pages)
steps.instruction: Connect to PC with USB.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:

Prerequisite:
1. Device which supports Dual SIM Dual Standby.
2. Insert 2 SIMs into the device.
objects.name: [DSDS] Turn off USB tethering

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Cellular & Data, enable data call of primary outgoing data SIM.

steps.expected: PC can connect to internet via this connection.(e.g. verify by opening web pages)
steps.instruction: Enable USB tethering from Internet sharing setting and connect to PC with USB.

steps.expected: PC cannot connect to internet via this connection.(e.g. verify by opening web pages)
steps.instruction: Disable USB tethering from Internet sharing setting.

steps.expected: PC cannot connect to internet via USB tethering as well.
steps.instruction: Change primary outgoing data to another SIM and repeat above steps again.

* Having a SIM card inserted without pin code with mcc/mnc not configured in .json file

* https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Firefox\_OS/Developing\_Gaia/Market\_customizations\_guide
* https://wiki.mozilla.org/B2G/QA/Customizations#Note
* http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobile\_country\_code

2. Complete the FTE

objects.description:
"As a user I want to be able to configure my phone to receive email from a 
POP3 email server and send email from an SMTP server.  I expect to 
provide only my email address, username and password (automatic setup) but I can provide server, SSL/TLS and port information (manual setup) if necessary."

@ Precondition:

1. First time to launch email app

2. Prepare a POP3 supported email account


* POP3 Test Account:
-- Web Client : http://www.aol.com/
-- Username: ffos.qa@aol.com
-- Password: firefoxos 

* Manual setup
+ POP3 Settings
-- Username: ffos.qa@aol.com
-- Hostname: pop.aol.com
-- SSL = 995 (default) 
+ SMTP Settings
-- Username: ffos.qa@aol.com
-- Hostname: smtp.aol.com
-- SSL = 465 (default)
objects.name: [Email][POP3][SSL] User can set up a POP3 account on email app

steps.instruction: Input the (1) User name, (2) email account, (3) Password, (4) Account type = POP3, (5) POP3 settings : Security = SSL , and (6) SMTP settings

objects.description:
As a user I do not want my phone to automatically download full messages or attachments until I choose  to read them or unless they are very small. I want to receive enough of  the message to be able to make that decision (from, subject, includes attachments and a small portion of the message body.)  When I chose to read an email the remainder of the email should be retrieved. I want to be notified before I download large messages and have the option to cancel the retrieval.  Large emails are those that are > 1  MB (to verify size limit).

@ Precondition: Setup a POP3 mail account on email app, we called account-1


* POP3 Test Account:
-- Web Client : http://www.aol.com/
-- Username: ffos.qa@aol.com
-- Password: firefoxos 

* Manual setup
+ POP3 Settings
-- Username: ffos.qa
-- Hostname: pop.aol.com
-- SSL = 995 (default) 
+ SMTP Settings
-- Username: ffos.qa
-- Hostname: smtp.aol.com
-- SSL = 465 (default)
objects.name: [Email][POP3] User can receive a plain text email via POP3 protocol

steps.instruction: Send a plain text email to account-1
Launch the email app

steps.expected: User can receive and read the plain text mail
steps.instruction: Check the inbox and select the plain text mail

objects.description:
As a user I do not want my phone to automatically download full messages or attachments until I choose  to read them or unless they are very small. I want to receive enough of  the message to be able to make that decision (from, subject, includes attachments and a small portion of the message body.)  When I chose to read an email the remainder of the email should be retrieved. I want to be notified before I download large messages and have the option to cancel the retrieval.  Large emails are those that are > 1  MB (to verify size limit).


* POP3 Test Account:
-- Web Client : http://www.aol.com/
-- Username: ffos.qa@aol.com
-- Password: firefoxos 

* Manual setup
+ POP3 Settings
-- Username: ffos.qa
-- Hostname: pop.aol.com
-- SSL = 995 (default) 
+ SMTP Settings
-- Username: ffos.qa
-- Hostname: smtp.aol.com
-- SSL = 465 (default)

objects.description: User Story As a user I expect to join up to 5 users into a conference call by making MO or MT calls. I expect to be able to put the conference call on hold while making or receiving a new call. As a user, if I have 5 people on a conference call, I have to drop the conference call to be able to make an emergency call. If I dont have 5 people on a conference call, I want to be able to put the conference call on hold and make an emergency call when needed. Preconditions: * dialer app is open * network supports up to 5 people on a conf call Acceptance Criteria: * user is informed if more than 5 people are attempted to be joined into a conf call of the max limit of 5 * user is informed that currently there is a conference call taking place on the dialer screen * user is informed of any error situation in a comprehend-able message

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).

objects.description:
Device should delete all SI messages with same SI-ID as an incoming SI message with "delete" action attribute.

Prerequisite: Using NowSMS(http://www.nowsms.com/) to send WAP Push messages to device.
objects.name: [WAP Push] Receiving a SI message with "delete" action attribute (One same SI-ID message is opened)

steps.instruction: Enable WAP Push in Message Settings.

steps.expected: Device will receive those messages.
steps.instruction:
In NowSMS, select WAP Push Message, send above 2 SI messages with following settings:
Push Type: SI,
WAP URL: a linkable URL, and please change this when sending next SI.
SI ID: abc1
Open one of the received messages and do not close it.

steps.expected: Device will NOT receive the new message, and all the SI message with same SI ID including the opened one will be closed and removed from notification bar.
steps.instruction:
Send another SI message with identical SI ID as above except:
WAP URL: a linkable URL.
Signal Action: Delete
SI ID: abc1

objects.description:
If a new SI message is received, identical SI-ID message on device and opened will be replaced.

Prerequisite: Using NowSMS(http://www.nowsms.com/) to send WAP Push messages to device.
objects.name: [WAP Push] Receiving SI newer than received and opened SI with identical SI-ID

steps.instruction: Enable WAP Push in Message settings.

steps.expected: Device will receive the message, open the message but not close it.
steps.instruction:
In NowSMS, select WAP Push Message, send a message with following settings:
Push Type: SI,
WAP URL: a linkable URL,
SI ID: ex:123,
SI Created: Set current date and time, ex: 2013-08-04T03:33:33Z

steps.expected: Device will receive the message and previous one will be replaced.
steps.instruction:
Send another SI message with identical SI ID as above except:
WAP URL: a different linkable URL.
SI ID: ex:123,
SI Created: Set current date and time later last message, ex: 2013-08-04T04:33:33Z

objects.description:

steps.expected: The track should start playing and you should see a pause button render in the UI.

steps.expected: The screen should be locked.

steps.expected: The music player is visible on the lock screen. All music controls should be visible and fully functional: play/pause button and back and forward controls.

steps.expected: A page only allow user to select SIM 2 shows.
steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Cellular & Data.

steps.expected: Under "Network Operators in the Area" the available network operators are listed and with the currently "Connected" network at the top of the list.
steps.instruction: Toggle "automatic selection" off.

steps.expected: Device will show whether connection is established or failed(depending on whether operators have roaming agreements or not)
steps.instruction: Select one of the operators.

objects.description:

steps.instruction: Go to Settings > Cellular & Data to enable SIM 1 data call.

steps.expected: WiFi is connected and data call icon of SIM 1 will be removed from status bar.
steps.instruction: Turn on WiFi and connect to an AP.

steps.expected: Wifi icon is off from status bar and SIM 1 data call icon will be shown again.
steps.instruction: Turn off Wifi.
Go to Settings > SIM manager, set outgoing data to SIM 2.
Enable SIM 2 data call.

steps.expected: WiFi is connected and data call icon of SIM 2 will be removed from status bar.
steps.instruction: Turn on WiFi and connect to an AP.

steps.expected: Wifi icon is off from status bar and SIM 2 data call icon will be shown again.
steps.instruction: Turn off Wifi.

Prerequisite:
- Delivery report switch is turned on (settings/message settings)
- sim card is available to send MMS
objects.name: User can see MMS delivery report

steps.expected: Check sender's message, when message received, the delivery status of message change from "sent" to "delivered"

steps.instruction: Long press on target message

User can see message recipient info, sent time, received time, message size, message status

Note: AT&T does not support this feature. Use T-mobile, or other carriers that support this feature to run this test case.
steps.instruction: Tap "View message report"

objects.description:
As a user I do not want my phone to automatically download full messages or attachments until I choose  to read them or unless they are very small. I want to receive enough of  the message to be able to make that decision (from, subject, includes attachments and a small portion of the message body.)  When I chose to read an email the remainder of the email should be retrieved. I want to be notified before I download large messages and have the option to cancel the retrieval.  Large emails are those that are > 1  MB (to verify size limit).

* POP3 Test Account:
-- Web Client : http://www.aol.com/
-- Username: ffos.qa@aol.com
-- Password: firefoxos 

* Manual setup
+ POP3 Settings
-- Username: ffos.qa
-- Hostname: pop.aol.com
-- SSL = 995 (default) 
+ SMTP Settings
-- Username: ffos.qa
-- Hostname: smtp.aol.com
-- SSL = 465 (default)
objects.name: [Email][POP3] Syncing the mails while FxOS is under high memory usage

steps.instruction: Try to launch many apps and let FxOS is under high memory usage

steps.expected: You can set up a POP3 account
steps.instruction: Sets up a POP3 email account which  no mail on email app

steps.expected: Email app can sync the mails without getting any problem.
steps.instruction: Check the inbox

As a user, I can make a emergency call even if there is no SIM card in the device.

Prerequisite: 1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby.
objects.name: [DSDS] Dial out emergency call when there is no SIM card

steps.instruction: Do not insert SIM card in device.

steps.expected: Call can be dialed out.
steps.instruction: Dial emergency call.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
Prerequisite:
- Delivery report switch is turned on (settings/message settings)
- sim card is available to send MMS
objects.name: User can see MMS delivery report on message thread view

steps.instruction: Send MMS, make sure MT can receive MMS as well (phone is turned on, MMS is available)

steps.expected: Sender will get a "message delivered" icon on message thread view
steps.instruction: When message delivered

steps.expected: Ddialog pop-up with "View message report"
steps.instruction: Long press on target message

steps.expected:
User can see message recipient info, sent time, received time, message size, message status  
Note: AT&T does not support this feature. Use T-mobile, or other carriers that support this feature to run this test case.
steps.instruction: Tap "View message report"

objects.description:
As a user I do not want my phone to automatically download full messages or attachments until I choose  to read them or unless they are very small. I want to receive enough of  the message to be able to make that decision (from, subject, includes attachments and a small portion of the message body.)  When I chose to read an email the remainder of the email should be retrieved. I want to be notified before I download large messages and have the option to cancel the retrieval.  Large emails are those that are > 1  MB (to verify size limit).


* POP3 Test Account:
-- Web Client : http://www.aol.com/
-- Username: ffos.qa@aol.com
-- Password: firefoxos 

* Manual setup
+ POP3 Settings
-- Username: ffos.qa
-- Hostname: pop.aol.com
-- SSL = 995 (default) 
+ SMTP Settings
-- Username: ffos.qa
-- Hostname: smtp.aol.com
-- SSL = 465 (default)
objects.name: [Email][POP3] Download a attachment while FxOS is under high memory usage

steps.instruction: Try to launch many apps and let FxOS is under high memory usage
Send a mail to a test email account with attachment on it. (10 MB)

steps.expected: You can set up a POP3 account
steps.instruction: Sets up the POP3 email account

steps.expected: You can download the attachment without getting any problem
steps.instruction: Check the mail and download the attachment

objects.description:
PREREQUISITES:
-----
* There is at least one MMS in the message app 
There is at least one contact in the contact list
objects.name: Forward an MMS to a contact for which there is already a thread previously created

steps.expected:
ER1. Message module options menu is shown 
ER2. New message composer screen is shown with the message to be forwarded in the text field. The 'To' field is empty. 
ER3. The list of contacts is shown 
ER4. The contact is added into the 'To' field 
ER5. The number is added into the 'To' field 
ER6. The message is sent correctly
steps.instruction:
1. Open Messaging app 
2. Open the MMS 
3. Long press on it (ER1) 
4. Tap on Forward message option (ER2) 
5. Tap on '+' icon to select a contact (ER3) 
6. Tap on a contact (ER4) 
7. Now, tap on 'To' field and add a phone number manually (ER5) 
8. Tap on Send key (ER6)

objects.description:
As a user,  I can still configure APN settings with support APPID within the message even though some are not supported.

Prerequisite: Using NowSMS(http://www.nowsms.com/) to send WAP Push messages to device.
objects.name: [OTA CP] Send a CP message with non-support APPID

steps.instruction: Enable WAP Push in Settings > Message setting on DUT.

steps.expected: CP message is received with a configuration message notification.
steps.instruction:
Open NowSMS on PC, go to "OMA provisioning content". Fill in following items then send to DUT. (Value can be changed, but keep the items listed below)
1.) Connection Type: GPRS
2.) Settings Name: CHT_MMS
3.) GPRS Access Point Name: emome
4.) WAP Proxy IP Address : 10.1.1.1
5.) WAP Proxy Port: 8080
6.) MMS Message Server URL: http://mms
7.) IMPS Server URL: http://test.mobi
8.) IMPS User Name: test
9.) IMPS Password: test
10.) OTA PIN:1234
11.) OTA PIN Type: Check User PIN

steps.expected: A page required PIN code is opened.
steps.instruction: Open the message.

steps.expected: Confirmation message shows that if user wants to save CHT_MMS.
steps.instruction: Enter the PIN code and press Accept button.

steps.expected: CHT_MMS is saved in it and values are the same as item 3 to 6 in step 2.
steps.instruction: Select ok and go to Data settings.

objects.description:
User Story:
As a user, I want the gallery app to automatically arrange content by the month 

If the user has taken six or more pictures within a single month, the month will create its own section.

Acceptance Criteria:
- When the gallery app is opened the user can see that all the content (images, videos) are arranged by month

Implementation bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=925179
objects.name: [Gallery] Confirm gallery shows pictures from a single month

steps.instruction: It is recommended for this testing to start with a clean SD card.

steps.expected: Photos are taken and are available to be seen in the gallery.
steps.instruction: Take six or more pictures with the camera at the same time.

steps.expected: Since you have taken six or more pictures within a single month, the month will create its own section. For example, if you are taking the pictures in December 2013, that label will be shown in the UI and the six pictures will be shown in grid format below the label.
steps.instruction: Open the gallery app.

objects.description:
User Story:
As a user, I want the gallery app to automatically arrange content by the month 

If a user has not taken at least six pictures within a single month but within a range of months, the pictures will be lumped within a single section and the title will reflect the span of time.

Acceptance Criteria:
- When the gallery app is opened the user can see that all the content (images, videos) are arranged by month

Implementation bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=925179
objects.name: [Gallery] Confirm gallery shows pictures from a range of months within a year

steps.instruction: It is recommended for this testing to start with a clean SD card and to have pictures taken from different months available to be imported to the SD card.

steps.expected: Photos are taken and are available to be seen in the gallery.
steps.instruction: Take three pictures with the camera at the same time.

steps.expected: Photos are imported and are available to be seen in the gallery.
steps.instruction: Turn on the USB Mass Storage option and import 2-3 pictures from different months within the same year.

steps.expected: Since the user has not taken at least six pictures within a single month but within a range of months, the pictures will be lumped within a single section and the title will reflect the span of time. An example label might be: June - July 2013.
steps.instruction: Open the gallery app.

objects.description:
User Story:
As a user, I want the gallery app to automatically arrange content by the month 

If the user has taken at least six pictures spanning more than one year, first and last month and relevant years will be displayed.

Acceptance Criteria:
- When the gallery app is opened the user can see that all the content (images, videos) are arranged by month

Implementation bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=925179
objects.name: [Gallery] Confirm gallery shows pictures from a range of months over years

steps.instruction: It is recommended for this testing to start with a clean SD card and to have pictures taken from different months and different years available to be imported to the SD card.

steps.expected: Photos are taken and are available to be seen in the gallery.
steps.instruction: Take at least 3 pictures with the camera at the same time.

steps.expected: Photos are imported and are available to be seen in the gallery.
steps.instruction: Turn on the USB Mass Storage option and import 4-6 pictures from different months and different years.

steps.expected: Since the user has taken at least six pictures spanning more than one year, first and last month and relevant years will be displayed. A sample label might be: December 2012 - December 2013 if you had taken pictures during the period from December, 2012 up until December, 2013.
steps.instruction: Open the gallery app.

objects.description:
User Story:
As a user, I want the gallery app to automatically arrange content by the month 

The date order will be chronological with the most recent pictures appearing at the top of the page. 

Acceptance Criteria:
- When the gallery app is opened the user can see that all the content (images, videos) are arranged by month

Implementation bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=925179
objects.name: [Gallery] Confirm gallery shows pictures in chronological order in the user interface

steps.instruction: It is recommended for this testing to start with a clean SD card and have a variety of pictures with taken in different months and different years.

steps.expected: Photos are taken and are available to be seen in the gallery.
steps.instruction: Take six or more pictures with the camera at the same time.

steps.expected: Photos are imported and are available to be seen in the gallery.
steps.instruction: Turn on USB Mass storage and import a series of pictures that were taken on different months and different years.

steps.expected: Pictures taken from Step 2 should show at the top of the UI, as they are the most recent. Pictures that were imported should show the relevant date or month or by grouped according to (1) Single Month, (2) Range of months within a year, and (3) Range of months over years.
steps.instruction: Open the gallery app.

objects.description:
During first time experience process, user can enable data call even though only one SIM inserted.

Prerequisite:
1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby.
2. Insert only one SIM card in either slot.
3. Update test build or cold reset device to enter FTE process
objects.name: [DSDS] Enable data call in FTE process with one SIM card inserted

steps.instruction: Enter FTE process after flash code or reset phone.

steps.expected: SIM manager should not be seen but Cellular Data page can be found.
steps.instruction: Go to each page and after language selection.

steps.expected: Data call of the SIM will be established(i.e. If slot 0 has the SIM, SIM 1 data icon will be seen, vice versa).
steps.instruction: Enable the data call on Cellular Data page.
Power off device and switch SIM card from current slot to another. Reset device in Device information > More information.

steps.expected: Data call of the SIM will be established(i.e. If slot 0 has the SIM, SIM 1 data icon will be seen, vice versa).
steps.instruction: Repeat step 1 to 3.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
During first time experience process, user can enable SIM 1 data call.

Prerequisite:
1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby.
2. Insert 2 SIM cards.
3. Update test build or cold reset device to enter FTE process
objects.name: [DSDS] Enable data call in FTE process (No SIM PIN enabled)

steps.instruction: Enter FTE process after flash code or reset phone.

steps.expected: Cellular Data page should be seen.
steps.instruction: Go to next few pages.

steps.expected: SIM 1 data call will be established.
steps.instruction: Enable data call in Cellular Data page.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
During first time experience process, user can enable data call after SIM PIN is unlocked.

Prerequisite:
1. Device which support Dual SIM Dual Standby.
2. Insert 2 SIM cards with all SIM PIN security enabled.
3. Update test build or cold reset device to enter FTE process
objects.name: [DSDS] Enable data call in FTE process (Both SIM PIN enabled)

steps.instruction: Enter FTE process after flash code or reset phone.

steps.expected: Enter PIN page for the SIM1 will be seen first.
steps.instruction: Go to each page and after language selection.

steps.expected: Retry information on PIN requestion page shows how many tries left.
steps.instruction: Enter incorrect PIN code to unlock SIM1 card.

steps.expected: PIN unlock page for the SIM2 will be seen next.
steps.instruction: Enter correct PIN code to unlock SIM1 card.

steps.expected: SIM manager page will be seen with correct SIM number(if SIM card has the information, some might be empty) and carrier information of both SIM cards.
steps.instruction: Enter correct PIN code to unlock SIM2 card.

steps.expected: Cellular Data page can be seen.
steps.instruction: Go to next page.

steps.expected: SIM 1 data call will be established.
steps.instruction: Enable data call on Cellular Data page.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.name: Test that I can enable & disable speaker mode in the FM Radio app to play sound out of the speaker

steps.expected: Then I shall hear sound out of the speaker of my phone & not through my headphones
steps.instruction: When I place headphones into my device, launch the FM Radio app, pick a station with sound, and select the speaker mode option to enable speaker mode

steps.expected: Then I shall no longer hear sound out of the speaker of my phone & instead, hear the sound through my headphones
steps.instruction: When I select the speaker mode option to disable speaker mode

objects.description:
Prerequisite: 2 phones with NFC & Bluetooth.

As a user, I would like to have the ability to receive URL by tapping on the other phone, and opened in "Browser"
objects.name: [NFC] URL submit by tapping phones together - Failed

steps.expected: NFC switched ON on both phones.
steps.instruction: Launch "Settings", Switch on NFC on both phones.

steps.expected: Paired okay, BT On
steps.instruction: Launch "Browser", Tap devices

steps.expected: device A should see the browser screen slide back automatically, and device B should not receive it
steps.instruction: Tap 2 phones together and slide forward on device A to send URL, and take device B away quickly before submission completed

objects.description:
As a user I do not want my phone to automatically download full messages or attachments until I choose  to read them or unless they are very small. I want to receive enough of  the message to be able to make that decision (from, subject, includes attachments and a small portion of the message body.)  When I chose to read an email the remainder of the email should be retrieved. I want to be notified before I download large messages and have the option to cancel the retrieval.  Large emails are those that are > 1  MB (to verify size limit).

@ Precondition: Setup a POP3 mail account on email app, we called account-1


* POP3 Test Account:
-- Web Client : http://www.aol.com/
-- Username: ffos.qa@aol.com
-- Password: firefoxos 

* Manual setup
+ POP3 Settings
-- Username: ffos.qa@aol.com
-- Hostname: pop.aol.com
-- SSL = 995 (default) 
+ SMTP Settings
-- Username: ffos.qa@aol.com
-- Hostname: smtp.aol.com
-- SSL = 465 (default)
objects.name: [Email][POP3] Attach a picture from Gallery and Cc yourself

steps.instruction: Launch the email app
Edit a new mail and attach a picture from gallery
Send out the mail to yourself
Check the inbox and select the mail which has a attachment(Picture) on it

steps.expected: User can get the attachment (Picture).
steps.instruction: Check the attachment and tap it

steps.expected: FxOS saved the duplicate picture on the internal/external storage but different file name
steps.instruction: Check the internal/external storage

objects.name: Verify that single variant is not executed for the second time after update the device(Sim configured)

steps.expected:
ER1 3rd party apps are installed automatically 
ER2 Single variant is not executed for the second time after update the device. You can verify it because the delete 3rd party app is not reinstalled

1. Flash the device with a build with single variant 
2. Complete the FTE 
ER1 
3. Delete a 3rd party app to other screen 
4. Going to Setting/Device Information/Check now to obtain the update 
5. Download and install the build update 
ER2

"214-005", 
"214-007" 
], 
"apps": [

"id": "Calculator", 
"screen": 3, 
"location": 0 
}

* https://wiki.mozilla.org/B2G/QA/Customizations#Note
* http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobile\_country\_code

ER1 
2. Opening market app and install and app in the slot scrren 3 location 0

objects.description:
While on a call with a Bluetooth headset, the user is able to place the call on hold while receiving a new call. When the new call ends, the user can return to the original (first) call. 

Prerequisite:  1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network. 2. Please make sure CDMA test account has call waiting enabled. You can check with carrier for more detail of how to enable it. 3. BT headset configured and paired. Call currently in session; with second call on hold.
objects.name: [CDMA][Bluetooth] Retrieving a call previously placed on hold when 2nd call terminates

steps.expected: Call can be answered.
steps.instruction: Dial a call to DUT, and press BT's button when there is a incoming call.

steps.expected: 1st call will be put on hold.
steps.instruction: Dial another call to DUT and answer it.

steps.expected: Current call is terminated and 1st call will be back.
steps.instruction: End 2nd call from DUT or remote party.

objects.description:
As a user that is currently on a phone call using a Bluetooth headset, I want to be able to answer another incoming call from the headset, placing the first call on hold. 

Prerequisite: 1. For CDMA phone only, make sure you have CDMA account under CDMA network. 2. Please make sure CDMA test account has call waiting enabled. You can check with carrier for more detail of how to enable it. 3. BT headset configured and paired. Call currently in session.
objects.name: [CDMA][Bluetooth] Placing an existing call on hold when an incoming call comes

steps.expected: Call notification appears.  If configured, call notification also appears audibly in the BT headset.
steps.instruction: Initiate an incoming call to the FFOS phone number.

steps.expected: First call is put on hold while second call  can be accepted.
steps.instruction: Tap the headset's call button to accept the call.

objects.description:
Implementation Bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=917445

#Pre-Requisites:  
#Gallery is launched and photo is in edit mode.
objects.name: [Gallery] Photo Editor - Automatic Image Enhancement

steps.instruction: Select the Edit option.

steps.expected: The text at the bottom of the screen changes to "Auto-enhance on" and the picture adjusts slightly (relative to color balance).
steps.instruction: Select the magic wand.

steps.expected:
The picture is saved with the auto enhancement features preserved.
"New Copy Save" caption appears below briefly and then disappears.
steps.instruction: Select the "Save" button.
Repeat Steps 1 and 2.

steps.expected: The text at the bottom of the screen changes to "Auto-enhance off" and the picture returns to its original state.
steps.instruction: Select the magic wand again.

objects.name: Test that I can get no notifications for a particular origin with no tag specified

steps.expected: Then the logcat should indicate that there were 0 notifications found
steps.instruction: When I go to http://mozilla-b2g.github.io/qa-testcase-data/webapi/notifications/ and select get under get notification

objects.name: Test that I can get no notifications for a particular origin with a tag specified

steps.expected: Then the logcat should indicate that there were 0 notifications found
steps.instruction: When I go to http://mozilla-b2g.github.io/qa-testcase-data/webapi/notifications/ and select get under get notification with a tag X specified

objects.name: Test that I can get no notifications for a particular origin with a tag specified with one notification previously shown

steps.expected: Then the logcat should indicate that there were 0 notifications found
steps.instruction: When I go to http://mozilla-b2g.github.io/qa-testcase-data/webapi/notifications/ and select get under get notification with a tag X specified with a notification shown previously with tag Y

objects.name: Test that I can get multiple notifications previously shown at an origin

steps.expected: Then the logcat should indicate that there were 2 notifications found with the correct title, dir, lang, body, & icon for each notification found
steps.instruction: When I go to http://mozilla-b2g.github.io/qa-testcase-data/webapi/notifications/  and select get under get notifications with two notifications previously shown with a title, dir, lang, body, & icon

objects.name: Test that I can get notifications for a specific origin previously shown when notifications were shown in multiple apps

steps.expected: Then the logcat should show that we only get back the notification that was generated at the URL, not at the app
steps.instruction: When I go to http://mozilla-b2g.github.io/qa-testcase-data/webapi/notifications/, install the hosted app, show a notification at the URL & app with different attributes for each notification, and select get under get notification at the URL

objects.name: Test that I cannot get notifications that have already closed for an origin

steps.expected: Then the logcat should show that no notifications were found by get
steps.instruction: When I go to http://mozilla-b2g.github.io/qa-testcase-data/webapi/notifications/, show a notification, close that notification, and select get under get notification at the URL

objects.name: Test that I can close a notification retrieved via the get function

steps.expected: Then the notification that is currently being shown should be closed & logcat should show evidence of onclose firing on both the notification shown previously & one that was retrieved via get
steps.instruction: When I go to http://mozilla-b2g.github.io/qa-testcase-data/webapi/notifications/, show a notification, select get under get notification, and chose to close the notification at index 1

objects.name: Test that onclick fires on a notification retrieved via get where clicking was done by user interaction

steps.expected: Then I should see evidence in logcat that onclick fired for that notification - both that was shown previously & one that was retrieved via get
steps.instruction: When I go to http://mozilla-b2g.github.io/qa-testcase-data/webapi/notifications/, show a notification, select get under get notification, and click the notification currently being shown

objects.name: Test that replacing a notification updates attributes in a notification retrieved via get

steps.expected: Then logcat should show evidence of the notification attribute dump showing the new attributes that were changed when the notification was replaced
steps.instruction: When I go to http://mozilla-b2g.github.io/qa-testcase-data/webapi/notifications/, show a notification with tag X with a set of attributes specified, select get under get notification, show a notification with a tag X with all attributes changed, and chose to dump attributes for index 1

objects.name: Test that I can get notification across a browser session with a page reload

steps.expected: Then logcat should show evidence that a single notification was found
steps.instruction: When I go to http://mozilla-b2g.github.io/qa-testcase-data/webapi/notifications/, show a notification, reload the page, and select get under get notification

objects.name: Test that I cannot get notifications shown previously in an older browser session than the current session

steps.expected: Then logcat should show evidence that 0 notifications were found
steps.instruction: When I go to  http://mozilla-b2g.github.io/qa-testcase-data/webapi/notifications/, show a notification, kill & restart the browser process, go to  http://mozqa.com/qa-testcase-data/webapi/notifications/ again, and select get under get notification
